name: places/ChIJN3IxbQv2wokRkidlYc0cEOk
formattedAddress: 35 W 126th St, New York, NY 10027, USA
adrFormatAddress: 35 W 126th St, New York, NY 10027-3810, USA

originalText.text: I was at this shelter for nearly 2 years . Horrible.  The client floors , rooms, and bathrooms did not get cleaned unless clients did it themselves and to do that you might be handed a tiny cup of cleaner that you had to rush to pour out before it melted the cup , and a paper towel... To clean 2 bathroom stalls, 3 showers and mop the floor behind 15 women( per floor) most of the time there was garbage, feces, urine, and blood ( menstrual) on the toilets and floors .    I got extremely ill trying to keep the both rooms clean and had to stop .   They didn't provide drinks with meals ...no water fountain, they had one water cooler for over 90 women that was empty for weeks on end .   If you had no money you took your chances with dirty sink faucets or just dehydrated.   Even during heat waves.     It was supposed to be a building for working clients..but good luck getting any sleep between fighting clients , midnight bed checks and staff waiting until 2 am or later to align a new comer to a room.   Most staff were rude , one in particular who enjoyed bullying clients.   Of course you had your problem clients..but this place should be shut down.    I know several ladies who've had to seek mental health counseling after experiencing that shelter.  Conditions in my room were inhumane...radiator pole blew out water ...to keep the room as dry as possible the window had to be cracked ..my bed was next to the window and heater, fan had to be left on and door cracked open.... Winter brought freezing temperatures in that room and you were lucky to wake up dry . Had to wrap my bedding in plastic when I'd leave for work to keep it dry ...woke several times a night to mop the ceiling and walls.    These things were reported many times to 311 and the coalition for the homeless..... Finally after almost 2 years it got fixed.     Horrible, depressing place where it's difficult if not impossible to stay focused on self help and success.    It took over a year to get my voucher and I finally just had to leave for my own sanity and health... Currently couch surfing unable to get anyone to accept this useless voucher.     Disgusting place.

originalText.text: If I could give this shelter a Negative Zero I would. What caused me mental and physical distress from this shelter was Staff. This is a woman's shelter and if your reading my review please record audio and video of everything that goes down in there. I was able to successfully get a transfer due to the unsafe environment ESPECIALLY with certain Male staff at this location.

originalText.text:
Greetings World,

Hello my name is Adriane Lee. I am currently a resident at 35 West 126th St Shelter (SUS). This is my permanent shelter since 3/2/2022. Since I've been residing in SUS this shelter should known to be the most unprofessional, unstable, unorganized, unsanitary and causes mental distress to my community and I. I was currently placed in a new bed and room witch was filled with  boogers on the wall, dope fiend, dirty sheets and blankets witch smelled like urine and there was also favoritism towards clients regarding who is allowed to keep the room doors CLOSED AND WINDOW CLOSED while we are in a pandemic. Last night I was placed in that room by Ms. Williams whos very rude, doesn't follow DHS guidelines, causes confrontations between clients, disrespects clients and I was  told by Supervisor Ms. Thomas who has never met me that she's going to make me very uncomfortable in the room I was put in. Also the room sockets did not work. The charger will completely fall out of the wall. On 4/19 at 12am 1/3 of my belongings was packed up my staff Mr. Curtis and put somewhere. Today I came and packed all my remanding's that were left in my assigned locker since I've first arrived in SUS.  I also was never told where are my things. Before being removed because of curfew I was in a 2 man room my roommate and I suffered everyday with soak and wet walls during cold days that wet ourselves and our bed and belongs left outside of our locker, a heating pipe that makes noise (there is a whole in the pipe), MOLD witch we have pictures of as well that can affect my current health conditions witch is asthma, high blood pressure, major ptsd and syncope.   Today as of 4/20/2022 and I haven't slept in 24hrs and I was unable to take my medications that I take at night and on the daily. If you are getting transferred here RUN AS FAST AS YOU CAN AND DONT LOOK BACK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Also you wouldn't want to be resting on bed sheets that 5 people slept on before you!!!!!

originalText.text: I don’t understand why my voucher won’t update and I keep getting from my case manager that the computer has to update it But it’s sad because I have to wait till my voucher expires in order for it to update? My broker told me that my voucher should have been updated. I work and been giving my paystub‘s nonstop, I’ve been here for almost 2 years. What’s going on?? And there’s no housing specialist.
